<< eps constructors functions i >>

eye

Creates an identity matrix.

Syntax

R = eye
R = eye(n)
R = eye(n, m)
R = eye(n, m, ..., z)
R = eye(n, m, ..., z, 'like', V)
R = eye(n, m, ..., z, classname)

Input argument

n

a variable: n-by-n matrix

m

a variable: n-by-m matrix

Description

eye returns an identity matrix.

Examples

eye(3)


eye(3,1,3,'single')


A = single([3 3])
B = eye(2,4,'like', A)


A = eye(0, 4)

See also

ones, zeros.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
